item.title: Functional Programming 101 - With Clojure
item.description: Here goes a simple yet interesting programming problem originally proposed by Mattox Beckman. After seeing Tejas Dinkar’s take on this problem using Haskell, I decided to give it a go with Clojure. You are Hercules, about to fight the dreaded Hydra. The Hydra has 9 heads. When a head is chopped off, it spawns 8 more heads. When one of these 8 heads is cut off, each one spawns out 7 more heads.
